posts.name: Charlie Haviland
posts.cooked:
I love having all emojis available for reactions, but the act of simply “liking” a message takes much longer in Signal than Instagram, for example, where you can quickly double-tap to add a heart emoji (and have your profile photo appear next to the heart to show everyone who’s liked it).

Since the double-tap gesture is not being used in Signal I think it would be nice to add a shortcut: Allow users to react with an emoji by double-tapping a message.

This could default to a simple “heart” or “thumbs up” emoji, but we could also let users pick a default emoji to be used when double-tapping a message.

link_counts.title: Improvement over the long press on the bubble menu
What feature should be bound to the "swipe left on message" gesture?
Double tap message to show up the message menu

posts.cooked:
I like that idea actually, it might also declutter the long press menu.

Would it still be possible to choose an emoji when double tapping, though? Or is it just a pre-set emoji?

posts.name: Charlie Haviland
posts.cooked:
Surfplank:

it might also declutter the long press menu.

Yes I was imagining that in cases where you just wanted to add a simple “like” reaction this would let you skip the long press menu altogether!

Surfplank:

Would it still be possible to choose an emoji when double tapping, though? Or is it just a pre-set emoji?

Good question, I was picturing a pre-set emoji because I thought if the user has to pick an emoji every time then they might as well just use the long-press menu.

That said, if you see a different way of structuring it please say so! I came here hoping for community input like this :)

I see, what you mean. I though more of splitting the emoji reaction form the long press, and double tapping might be quicker than long pressing. But your idea would also be pretty nice, I probably use the thumbs up most of the time. I am not sure if there should be two ways for reactions though (maybe no problem at all just mentioning it :) ). The big difference with instagram (as I understand from your message) is that it only has one reaction type, this might be confusing if not implemented very clearly.

Just for reference:

Emoji reactions

FWIW, there’s already a shortcut (you don’t have to tap twice):
Just long press and don’t lift your finger , but swipe it over to the desired emoji.

That being said, I don’t expect something like “double-tap to default react” is going to be implemented (since there’s already more than one way to react and easy gestures are rare).

Reactions are pretty fast to create if you do it the way that PiCob also mentioned.
Maybe some users would prefer the double tap action, but I find it very unlikely to be implemented. I’m sorry for that, your only option would be to use/create a fork.

posts.name: Charlie Haviland
posts.cooked:
fossislovefossislife:

I find it very unlikely to be implemented

Sure, that’s understandable! Yes, @PiCob’s suggestion does make it faster, and I know that we’re talking about fractions of a second here so it’s hard to justify big changes.

That said, I do think it’s really nice that Instagram allows you to see who liked your message without any clicks at all. I know that becomes harder when you offer all emojis like Signal does, but I’m wondering if it makes sense to show the thumbnail image for the participant next to their reaction, or perhaps if someone can think of a different way to see who’s reacted to a message without clicking on the reaction

This is a great idea. The double-tap to “like” has already been popularized by Instagram and other apps, so unless Signal is reserving double-tap for some future/planned function, there doesn’t appear to be any real downside to implementing this.

Chaviland7:

we could also let users pick a default emoji to be used when double-tapping a message.

Facebook Messenger actually has a functionality similar to this, but it is separate from message reactions, and actually is its own button – next to the text input area is an “emoji” button that you can tap to send a specific emoji in the chat. It defaults to “thumbs up”, but through the chat settings you can customize it to one of several different emoji. The setting is per-conversation.
I also think it would be a better way to go. Long pressing often is used for selecting a message or text and in my view Signal breaks this intuitive workflow.

posts.name: Cheng
posts.cooked:
I like the facebooks approach, it is very fun and eye catching. When I used to use Facebook Messenger with my girlfriend (now using signal, of course), people asked me what that is all the time.

We use a poop emoji for our chat emoji, and watching it grow is hilarious.

posts.name: Charlie Haviland
posts.cooked:
Yes I actually agree that facebook’s approach is cool and the emoji that gets set for a chat can be fun! If Signal wants to implement that I think it would be nice, but here’s an example of why I’m suggesting it could be made a bit more complex:

I have a group chat with close friends living around the world. With instagram it’s easy for us to “like” messages, and then for others to see, when catching up to the convo, who liked which ones (with no clicks). I think a really fun way to implement something like this would be for each person in the chat to pick a default emoji that could be used as a “quick” reaction with a double-tap. In most cases it could be a heart or thumbs up, but for example my friends and I could pick the flag of the country we’re in! If that were the case then I could scroll through missed messages and get a sense of who “liked” what messages by what flags I see (like how Instagram shows the profile image next to the heart reaction).

I’m fully aware this isn’t a necessary feature, but if double-tap isn’t being saved for something important I think this could be a cool use for it. As a developer I’d also be happy to try contributing to the feature if it’s something the community would want to see/merge.

posts.name: Charlie Haviland
posts.cooked:
Don’t mean to beat a dead horse here, but I noticed yesterday that the latest version of FB Messenger for android implements the exact functionality described earlier in this thread:

Double-tap to add a heart emoji reaction, and then long press to open the emoji reaction menu.

Certainly Facebook doing something doesn’t make it right (lol) but perhaps that will drive other UIs to follow this pattern, which will reduce the chance of a user being confused by it.

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
Chaviland7:

latest version of FB Messenger for android implements the exact functionality described earlier in this thread:

Double-tap to add a heart emoji reaction, and then long press to open the emoji reaction menu.

I noticed this the other day too, and to be honest I really like it. I didn’t see much of a reason to add this to Signal before, but I find that in Messenger it’s really helpful for quickly indicating to someone that you “like” their message. Double-tap for heart, long press for everything else.

posts.name: Charlie Haviland
posts.cooked:
Yes I admit that this feature sounds pretty unimportant because it only saves a little bit of time, but I’m glad you agree after trying it out!

I actually also saw yesterday that not only have they added the “double-tap to like” functionality, but they’re allowing users to customize the emoji which gets added (like in my example above with the flags).

This is my first feature request so I’m not really sure how to raise this with the signal developers, but I do feel it’s gotten a positive response, and the new functionality from FB may make this more of a standard direction to go in with regards to reactions.

Chaviland7:

how to raise this with the signal developers

You don’t have to. They’re following the topics here and read the posts.

posts.name: Divyansh Shekhar Gaur
posts.cooked:
“Swipe up to choose reaction” in addition to “double-tap to react with default emoji” will be cherry on the cake. It will make reactions way faster than they are now.

This should be implemented across iOS, Android, and Desktop.

And frees the long-klick action to could be used for (expected) multiselect messages.
Nice idea.
And it would be helpful for people who are already familiar with the instagram way of reacting to messages with emojis…
I would love to see this implemented… Double-tap to display the emoji reactions…As an alterantive to long-pressing.
